name: CIS Controls v8
description: The CIS Critical Security Controls are a prioritized set of actions that collectively form a defense-in-depth set of best practices to mitigate the most common attacks.

framework.name: CIS Controls v8
framework.description: Center for Internet Security Critical Security Controls Version 8

structure.title: Control 1: Inventory and Control of Enterprise Assets
structure.description: Actively manage all enterprise assets connected to the infrastructure

items.title: 1.1 Establish and Maintain Detailed Enterprise Asset Inventory
items.description: Establish and maintain an accurate, detailed, and up-to-date inventory of all enterprise assets
questions: Is there a complete asset inventory?

items.title: 1.2 Address Unauthorized Assets
items.description: Ensure that a process exists to address unauthorized assets on a weekly basis

items.title: 1.3 Utilize an Active Discovery Tool
items.description: Utilize an active discovery tool to identify assets connected to the enterprise's network

structure.title: Control 2: Inventory and Control of Software Assets
structure.description: Actively manage all software on the network so only authorized software is installed and can execute

items.title: 2.1 Establish and Maintain a Software Inventory
items.description: Establish and maintain a detailed inventory of all licensed software installed on enterprise assets

items.title: 2.2 Ensure Authorized Software is Currently Supported
items.description: Ensure that only currently supported software is designated as authorized

items.title: 2.3 Address Unauthorized Software
items.description: Ensure that unauthorized software is either removed or the inventory is updated

structure.title: Control 3: Data Protection
structure.description: Develop processes and technical controls to identify, classify, securely handle, retain, and dispose of data

items.title: 3.1 Establish and Maintain a Data Management Process
items.description: Establish and maintain a data management process
questions: Is there a data management policy?

items.title: 3.2 Establish and Maintain a Data Inventory
items.description: Establish and maintain a data inventory based on the enterprise's data management process

items.title: 3.3 Configure Data Access Control Lists
items.description: Configure data access control lists based on a user's need to know
questions: Are ACLs configured based on need-to-know?

structure.title: Control 4: Secure Configuration of Enterprise Assets and Software
structure.description: Establish and maintain the secure configuration of enterprise assets and software

items.title: 4.1 Establish and Maintain a Secure Configuration Process
items.description: Establish and maintain a secure configuration process for enterprise assets and software

items.title: 4.2 Establish and Maintain a Secure Configuration Process for Network Infrastructure
items.description: Establish and maintain a secure configuration process for network devices

structure.title: Control 5: Account Management
structure.description: Use processes and tools to assign and manage authorization to credentials for user accounts

items.title: 5.1 Establish and Maintain an Inventory of Accounts
items.description: Establish and maintain an inventory of all accounts managed in the enterprise

items.title: 5.2 Use Unique Passwords
items.description: Use unique passwords for all enterprise assets

items.title: 5.3 Disable Dormant Accounts
items.description: Delete or disable any dormant accounts after a period of 45 days of inactivity

structure.title: Control 6: Access Control Management
structure.description: Use processes and tools to create, assign, manage, and revoke access credentials and privileges

items.title: 6.1 Establish an Access Granting Process
items.description: Establish and follow a process to grant access to enterprise assets and software
questions: Is there an access request process?

items.title: 6.2 Establish an Access Revoking Process
items.description: Establish and follow a process to revoke access to enterprise assets and software
